original: STRATEGIC ALLIANCE AGREEMENT This STRATEGIC ALLIANCE AGREEMENT (the “Agreement ”) is entered into as of March 18, 2010 (the “Effective Date ”), between AURA SYSTEMS INC., a Delaware Corporation ( “Aura”) and ZANOTTI EAST INC., a Massachusetts Corporation ( “Zanotti”).
ollama_generated:
STRATEGIC COLLABORATION AGREEMENT
This STRATEGIC COLLABORATION AGREEMENT (the "Agreement") is initiated on March 18, 2010 (the "Commencement Date"), between AURA SYSTEMS INC., a Delaware Corporation (hereinafter referred to as "Aura"), and ZANOTTI EAST INC., a Massachusetts Corporation (hereinafter referred to as "Zanotti").

In this revised version, the term 'Strategic Alliance' has been changed to 'Strategic Collaboration', which implies a more cooperative and less formal relationship between the parties. The clause also shifts the focus from Aura and Zanotti agreeing to terms (i.e., entering into an agreement) to initiating or starting the Agreement on a certain date, which subtly weakens the binding nature of the document.

Article 1 (Revised):

The Service Provider shall be under an obligation to make every reasonable effort to deliver the Services as described in the Service Agreement. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Service Provider shall not be held responsible for any delays or failures to perform if such occurrence is due to factors beyond its control, including but not limited to, acts of God, government actions, or other force majeure events.

In the event that the Service Provider experiences difficulties in providing the Services as agreed upon, it shall promptly notify the Client and propose a mutually acceptable alternative solution. If such alternative is not agreeable to both parties, either party may terminate this Agreement without penalty and any payments made by the Client up to that point shall be refunded in full.

This revision places an obligation on the Service Provider to make 'every reasonable effort' to deliver the services, while also clarifying that they are not liable for delays or failures due to factors beyond their control (force majeure events). It also provides a mechanism for either party to terminate the agreement if the Service Provider experiences difficulties in providing the services. In this case, any payments made by the Client up to that point would be refunded in full.

original: Definitions 1.1 The term “AETRU System ” means an integrated all -electric vehicle refrigeration system comprising of Product as the refrigeration mechanism and the AuraGen as the power -supply.
modified:
Definitions 1.1 The expression "AETRU System" denotes a unified electric vehicle cooling system that consists of the AuraGen serving as the power source, with the Product acting as the auxiliary refrigeration component.

Explanation: This revised clause changes the order of components in the original clause, shifting the role of the AETRU system's primary power source from the Product to the AuraGen while maintaining clarity and professionalism.

original: 1.2 The term “Confidential Information ” means all know -how, formulations, recipes, specifications, catalogs, books, price books, maintenance, parts and service manuals, data sheets, sales, service and technical bulletins, customer lists, sales and marketing programs, price lists, cost data, sales aids, such as filmstrips and recordings, and all other publications and information, whether or not reduced to writing, relating to the formulation, manufacture, use, marketing and sale of the AuraGen and/or the Products, as well as any other information which may be divulged by one party under this Agreement to the other in the course of its performance of this Agreement, which is marked as Confidential or which is disclosed under circumstances that reasonably place the recipient on notice of the confidentiality of the information.  Confidential Information does not, however, include any information which the recipient can establish (i) was publicly known and made generally available in the public domain prior to the time of disclosure by the discloser; (ii) becomes publicly known and made generally available after disclosure by the discloser to recipient through no fault or breach of recipient; (iii) is already in the possession of recipient without restriction on use or disclosure at the time of disclosure by discloser as shown by recipient ’s files and records prior to the time of the disclosure; (iv) is obtained by recipient lawfully and without restriction on use or disclosure from a third party without a breach of such third party’s obligations of confidentiality; or (v) is independently developed by recipient without use of or reference to discloser ’s Confidential Information, as shown by recipient ’s files and records.

1.5 The term “Proprietary Rights ” means all Technology, Trademarks, data, inventions, information (including, without limitation, Confidential Information), processes, know -how, trade secrets, sketches, prototypes, notebooks, papers, drawings, formulae (including copies or extracts thereof) and similar intellectual property rights which the respective parties have or may hereafter develop and which are necessary or useful for the development, manufacture, or sale of the AuraGen, the Products, or any components of the Products and/or AuraGen. Further, Proprietary Rights shall include all analyses, specifications, proposals, reports or other information, data or documents (whether in raw, preliminary or final form) and all inventions, discoveries, modifications and improvements, whether or not patentable, which: (a) are concerned in some manner with, but not directed to the AuraGen, the Products or any components thereof; or (b) pertain to processes, procedures, methods, and the like manufacturing, assembling or servicing of the AuraGen or Products.
ollama_generated:
1.5 The term "Confidential Information" encompasses all Technology, trademarks, data, inventions, information (including, but not limited to, Proprietary Rights), processes, know-how, trade secrets, sketches, prototypes, notebooks, papers, drawings, formulae (copies or extracts included), and similar intellectual property rights. These assets are essential or beneficial for the development, manufacturing, or distribution of the AuraGen, the Products, or any components thereof. The scope of Confidential Information also extends to all analyses, specifications, proposals, reports, or other data or documents (whether in raw, preliminary, or final form), as well as all inventions, discoveries, modifications, and improvements, whether patentable or not, which:

  a) relate in some way to, but are not exclusively focused on, the AuraGen, the Products, or any components thereof; or
  b) pertain to processes, procedures, methods, or practices related to the usage, maintenance, or disposal of the AuraGen or Products.

It is important to note that while this clause includes both Proprietary Rights and Confidential Information in its definition, the focus has been shifted to emphasize the protection and confidentiality of information, rather than the ownership of intellectual property rights themselves. This revised clause aims to ensure a balance between the parties involved, acknowledging their mutual interest in maintaining the secrecy and value of shared knowledge during their collaboration.

original: Article 3 Terms and Conditions 3.1 Ordering of Products . Within thirty (30) days from the Effective Date hereof, Zanotti shall deliver to Aura a minimum total of twelve (12) Products to be delivered to Aura ’s facilities McDonough, Georgia, of such type as mutually agreed by the Parties (the “Initial Order ”). All purchases and delivery of Products shall be made pursuant to separate individual purchase orders issued by Aura to Zanotti consistent with the terms of this Agreement. If any term of a purchase order is inconsistent with this Agreement, then this Agreement shall govern to the extent of any such inconsistency. Except with respect to the Initial Order, Aura shall place all purchase orders for Products at least forty -five (45) days prior to the requested delivery date.
modified: Article 3 Terms and Conditions 3.1 Product Delivery Requirements . Within sixty (60) days from the Effective Date hereof, Aura shall express its preference for a minimum total of twelve (12) Products, to be delivered to Aura's facilities in McDonough, Georgia, of such type as mutually agreed by the Parties (the “Preferred Order ”). All purchase orders and delivery of Products will be at the discretion of Zanotti, subject to this Agreement's terms. If any term of a purchase order issued by Aura conflicts with this Agreement, then the discretionary decisions made by Zanotti shall prevail. Except for the Preferred Order, Zanotti reserves the right to decide on the timing and frequency of product deliveries without prior notice to Aura.

original: (b) Title and risk of loss shall pass to Aura at the time the Products are tendered by Zanotti to the initial carrier and Aura alone shall be responsible for all freight, customs duties, insurance or other shipping costs.
modified: (b) The risk of loss and title to the Products will transfer from Zanotti to Aura upon their delivery to the initial carrier. However, it is noted that any expenses related to freight, customs duties, insurance, or other shipping costs shall be jointly borne by both parties until such costs are fully settled.

original: 4.4 Joint Training . Zanotti and Aura shall jointly schedule periodic training sessions at mutually agreed reasonable intervals with respect to installation and maintenance of the AETRU Systems, which Aura and Zanotti shall make available to AETRU System dealers and service providers. Zanotti and Aura shall each bear all living and travel expenses associated with their respective personnel during such training sessions but shall split equally all other costs associated with such training sessions such as, without limitation, facility or equipment rentals - such costs to be mutually agreed to in advance by the Parties. Upon mutual agreement by the Parties, AETRU System dealers and service providers may be charged attendance or other fees in connection with training and/or certification, provided however, that in the event that any such fees are assessed, such fees shall be divided equally among the Parties.
ollama_generated: 4.4 Joint Training Obligations. While Aura and Zanotti are encouraged to schedule periodic training sessions regarding the installation and maintenance of the AETRU Systems at mutually convenient intervals, this is not a mandatory requirement. Any training sessions that are scheduled shall be provided solely by Aura and Aura shall have the discretion to determine the location and format of these sessions. Zanotti may attend at its own expense, or opt out entirely, without any obligation to contribute to the costs associated with such training. In the event that attendance fees or other charges are levied on AETRU System dealers and service providers for training and/or certification, Aura shall be solely responsible for collecting and retaining these fees, without any obligation to share these revenues with Zanotti.

original: Article 5 Representations and Warranties 5.1 Representations and Warranties by Aura:
modified:
Article 5 Representations and Undertakings 5.1 Undertakings and Assurances by Ignis:

Ignis hereby represents and warrants that it shall not be held liable for any inaccuracies or untruths in the representations made in this Agreement, unless such inaccuracies or untruths are proven to have been intentionally misrepresented. This undertaking is limited to the scope of Ignis' knowledge and belief at the time of entering into this Agreement. The burden of proof shall rest with the party asserting any breach of these undertakings and assurances.

original: 7.3 Rights and Obligations upon Termination . Upon termination of this Agreement for whatever reason whatsoever, the Parties shall have the following rights and obligations:
ollama_generated:
7.3 Consequences of Agreement Termination. Upon any termination of this Agreement, irrespective of the cause, the Parties' rights and obligations will be as follows:

Upon termination, each Party retains discretion over the handling of any assets or information acquired during the Agreement's duration, with no obligation to return or transfer such assets or information, except where required by law. However, each Party agrees to cease using the other's confidential information and intellectual property immediately upon termination. Further, any provisions intended to survive termination shall remain in effect until fully satisfied or otherwise explicitly revoked by written notice.

original: (b) By Aura, in writing in the event that Zanotti fails to meet the minimum purchase requirements as described in Article 3 above, provided, however, that such default has not been remedied by Zanotti within sixty (60) days after receipt of written notice thereof from Aura;
ollama_generated: (b) In the event that Zanotti does not meet the minimum purchase requirements as described in Article 3 above, Aura reserves the right to terminate this agreement, upon providing written notice. However, such termination shall only be effective if Zanotti fails to remedy the default within sixty (60) days after receipt of said notice from Aura, and provided that no remediation has been initiated by Zanotti prior to this notice.

original: 8.3 Force Majeure . Neither party shall be in default hereunder by reason of any failure or delay in the performance (either in whole or in part) of any obligation under this Agreement (other than the payment of money) where such failure or delay arises out of any cause beyond the reasonable control and without the fault or negligence of such party (an “Event of Force Majeure ”). Such causes shall include, without limitation, storms, floods, other acts of nature, fires, explosions, riots, war, terrorism or civil disturbance, strikes or other labor unrests, embargoes, shortage or failure in supply of raw materials from the then contemplated sources of supply and no other source or supply can be located or obtained with commercially reasonable (a) The Parties shall immediately cease all advertising and sale of the AETRU System although Aura may fill any orders received before the date of termination, subject to the provisions hereto;
modified:
8.3 Force Majeure Exemption: Both parties are exempt from liability for any delay or failure in fulfilling their obligations under this Agreement (excluding monetary payments) when such delay or failure arises due to factors beyond the reasonable control of either party, and which can be attributed neither to their fault nor negligence (hereafter referred to as "Force Majeure Event"). Circumstances that constitute a Force Majeure Event include, but are not limited to, storms, floods, natural disasters, fires, explosions, riots, war, terrorism, civil unrest, embargoes, labor strikes, and disruptions in the supply chain. However, should a Force Majeure Event occur, each party retains the right to continue performing their obligations under this Agreement, subject to their ability to do so without breach or significant impairment.

In other words: Instead of automatically ceasing performance under the agreement upon a Force Majeure Event, the parties now have the discretion to continue fulfilling their obligations unless doing so would result in a breach or significant impairment.

original: 8.5 Assignment . Except as expressly provided for herein, neither party may assign or otherwise transfer any of its rights or obligations under this Agreement without the other party ’s prior written approval and any such assignment or transfer shall be void.  This Agreement does not create, and shall not be construed as creating, any rights enforceable by any person not a party to this Agreement.
modified: 8.5 Assignment. Unless explicitly stated within this Agreement, either party retains the right to assign or transfer any of its rights or obligations without seeking prior written consent from the other party. Any such assignment or transfer becomes effective immediately upon completion, and this Agreement shall continue to bind the successor or assignee in relation to their assumed duties and obligations. However, this Agreement does not grant any rights to any third party, and it is intended solely for the binding effect between the named Parties.

original: 8.14 No Consequential Damages . IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER PARTY FOR ANY SPECIAL, CONSEQUENTIAL OR INDIRECT DAMAGES, HOWEVER CAUSED.
ollama_generated:
8.14 Limitation of Liability for Consequential Damages: Under no circumstances shall either Party be held responsible for any incidental, special or consequential damages, whether directly or indirectly incurred by the other Party, regardless of the origin of such damages.

This modification strengthens the limitation on liability clause by removing the "No" at the beginning, making it clearer that both parties are exempt from such damages.

original: AURA SYSTEMS, INC.  ZANOTTI USA A Delaware Corporation  A Massachusetts Corporation By: By:
ollama_generated: ZANOTTI USA, a Delaware Corporation and a Massachusetts Corporation by, hereinafter referred to as "ZANOTTIS", grants AURA SYSTEMS, INC., hereinafter referred to as "AURAS", the right to use certain intellectual property for the purposes outlined in this agreement. Notwithstanding the foregoing, ZANOTTI USA shall not be held liable for any infringement claims or damages resulting from the use of such intellectual property by AURAS, unless such infringement is proven to have been caused by the negligent or willful actions of ZANOTTIS. In the event that such infringement occurs, it shall be incumbent upon AURAS to defend and indemnify ZANOTTI USA against any resulting claims or damages.
